description: Field pea breeding is part of the Cereal and Pulse Science Strategy of Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC). Field Pea breeding lines with improved agronomic characteristics, disease resistance and other traits have to be tested before they can be registered at the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) and marketed to Canadian Pea Producers.

### ACAN for Field Pea Co-operative Registration Testing Trials
#### Reference Number
PW-23-01021686
#### Solicitation Number
01R11-24-C001
#### Publication Date
January 17, 2023
#### Tender Closing Date
January 31, 2023, 2:00 PM CST
#### Contracting Authority
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada, Mr. Melissa Smith
**Job Description**
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) is seeking a contractor to coordinate and administer the Field Pea Co-operative Registration Testing Trials. The contractor will be responsible for providing the necessary services to test field pea breeding lines in coordination with the Prairie Recommending Committee for Pulses and Special Crops (PRCPSC) and the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA).

**Scope of Work**
* Coordinate and administer the Field Pea Co-operative Registration Testing Trials
* Distribute seed packages to testing sites and ensure trials are conducted according to PRCPSC-approved protocols
* Collect and summarize data from all testing sites, including agronomic, disease, and quality data
* Prepare a report summarizing the results of the testing trials

**Criteria for Assessment of the Statement of Capabilities**

Any interested supplier must demonstrate by way of a Statement of Capabilities that they have the right, as determined by CFIA, to coordinate the Field Pea Co-operative Registration Testing Trials.

**Contract Period**
April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024, with four (4) one-year options to extend

**Estimated Value**
$42,257.00 (including GST)

**Pre-identified Supplier**
University of Saskatchewan Dept. of Plant Sciences, 51 Campus Drive, Unit 4D36, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan S7N 5A8

**SOLE SOURCE JUSTIFICATION**
CFIA has determined that the University of Saskatchewan is the only coordinator of the Field Pea Co-operative Registration Tests for pulse crop breeders.

**ACAN NOTICE**
You are hereby notified that the government intends to negotiate with one firm only as identified above. Should you have any questions concerning this requirement, contact the Contracting Authority.

An ACAN allows departments and agencies to post a notice, for no less than fifteen (15) calendar days, indicating to the supplier community that it intends to award a good, service or construction contract to a pre-identified contractor.
